data.title: U.S. Open Champions Autographed Ball Collection
data.meta_description: U.S. Open Champions Autographed Ball Collection Golf Autographs Tiger Woods
data.text:
This historic collection contains 52 U.S. Open Champions autographed golf balls - probably one of the most complete collections available!

Beginning with Gene Sarazen (1922, 1932) the collection includes: Sam Parks Jr. (1935), Byron Nelson (1939), Jack Fleck (1955), Tommy Bolt (1958), Billy Casper (1959), Arnold Palmer (1960), Gene Littler (1961), Jack Nicklaus (1962, 1967, 1972, 1980), Ken Venturi (1964), Gary Player (1965), Lee Trevino (1968, 1971) Orville Moody (1969), Tony Jacklin (1970), Johnny Miller (1973), Hale Irwin (1974, 1979, 1990), Lou Graham (1975), Jerry Pate (1976), Hubert Green (1977), Andy North (1978), David Graham (1981) Tom Watson (1982), Larry Nelson (1983), Fuzzy Zoeller (1984), Raymond Floyd (1986), Scott Simpson (1987), Curtis Strange (1988, 1989), Payne Stewart (1991, 1999), Tom Kite (1992), Lee Janzen (1993, 1998), Ernie Els (1994, 1997), Corey Pavin (1995), Steve Jones (1996), Tiger Woods (2000, 2002, 2008), Retief Goosen (2001, 2004), Jim Furyk (2003), Michael Campbell (2005), Geoff Ogilvy (2006), Angel Cabrera (2007), Lucas Glover (2009), Graeme McDowell (2010), Rory McIlroy (2011), Webb Simpson (2012), Justin Rose (2013), Martin Kaymer (2014), Jordan Spieth (2015), Dustin Johnson (2016), Brooks Koepka (2017, 2018), Gary Woodland (2019), Bryson DeChambeau (2020), Jon Rahm (2021), and Matthew Fitzpatrick (2022).

Engraved plates and places are included for: Cary Middlecoff (1949 & 1956), Julius Boros (1952), Ben Hogan (1948, 1950, 1951 & 1953), Ed Furgol (1954), and Dick Mayer (1957), as well as places for 10 future U.S. Open Champions.

The handsome display case features UV protective glass to protect the collection for generations to come as well as a mahogany door, green suede mat and lock and keys.

Framed Dimensions: 32" x 30" x 3"
